name: PasswordPolicy
description: Defines composition rules and lifecycle requirements for authentication credentials to ensure account security across diverse applications and industries. This entity establishes standards for credential complexity including minimum length, required character types, uniqueness constraints, and prohibited patterns. It governs credential rotation through expiration intervals, reuse prevention via history tracking, and minimum age requirements to prevent rapid successive changes. The policy enforces security through pattern validation, dictionary attack prevention, sequential character blocking, and integration with known compromise databases. Organizations apply different policies based on privilege levels, regulatory requirements, and risk tolerance - higher privilege accounts typically require stronger credentials with more frequent rotation. The entity supports customizable character set definitions, regex-based pattern enforcement, and configurable validation rules. This abstraction applies universally across systems requiring credential-based authentication, from enterprise applications to consumer services, enabling consistent security postures while accommodating varying organizational needs and industry-specific requirements.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Unique identifier for this credential policy, used to distinguish between different security requirement levels within an organization

properties.name: description
properties.description: Human-readable explanation of the policy's purpose, intended application scope, and rationale for its specific requirements
properties.example: Standard credential policy for regular user accounts with moderate security requirements

properties.name: minLength
properties.description: Minimum number of characters required in the credential, balancing security against user memorability

properties.name: maxLength
properties.description: Maximum number of characters allowed in the credential, preventing potential storage or processing issues

properties.name: requireUppercase
properties.description: Whether credential must include at least one uppercase letter (A-Z) to increase character space complexity

properties.name: requireLowercase
properties.description: Whether credential must include at least one lowercase letter (a-z) to increase character space complexity

properties.name: requireNumeric
properties.description: Whether credential must include at least one numeric digit (0-9) to expand the possible character combinations

properties.name: requireSpecial
properties.description: Whether credential must include at least one special character from the defined character set to maximize entropy

properties.name: allowedSpecialCharacters
properties.description: String containing all special characters permitted in credentials, allowing organizations to restrict problematic symbols

properties.name: minUniqueCharacters
properties.description: Minimum count of distinct characters required, preventing credentials composed of excessive character repetition

properties.name: prohibitCommonCredentials
properties.description: Whether to check credentials against databases of frequently-used weak choices that are vulnerable to dictionary attacks

properties.name: prohibitPersonalInfo
properties.description: Whether credential cannot contain elements from the account holder's identity information such as name, identifier, or contact details

properties.name: maxRepeatingCharacters
properties.description: Maximum number of consecutive identical characters permitted, preventing patterns like 'aaaa' or '1111' that reduce effective entropy

properties.name: prohibitSequentialCharacters
properties.description: Whether to prevent sequential patterns like 'abc', '123', or 'xyz' that are easily guessable

properties.name: maxValidityDays
properties.description: Number of days credential remains valid before requiring rotation, with 0 indicating no expiration

properties.name: expirationNoticeDays
properties.description: Number of days before expiration when the system begins notifying the account holder to prepare for credential rotation

properties.name: historyDepth
properties.description: Number of previous credentials retained in history that cannot be reused, preventing simple rotation cycles

properties.name: minRotationIntervalDays
properties.description: Minimum number of days that must elapse before credential can be changed again, preventing circumvention of history rules through rapid rotation

properties.name: prohibitKnownCompromised
properties.description: Whether to check if credential appears in databases of exposed credentials from security breaches, preventing use of publicly known compromised values

properties.name: customPattern
properties.description: Regular expression pattern that credential must match for organization-specific requirements beyond standard composition rules

examples.name: Enhanced Security Policy
examples.description: Strengthened credential requirements for privileged accounts with access to sensitive resources

examples.name: Standard User Policy
examples.description: Balanced credential requirements for regular accounts with standard security needs

examples.name: Customer Account Policy
examples.description: User-friendly credential requirements for consumer-facing services balancing security with accessibility
